job.title: IT Solution Analyst - Financial Systems
job.plaincontent:
Drucken / als PDF speichern
IT Solution Analyst - Financial Systems
Lieu de travail: RenensTaux d’occupation: 100
Well, we're looking for talented people who share our interests and values. Do you focus on the essential and do what you say? Do you try to make things simple and dare to be original in what you say and do? And most of all, do you excel in providing exceptional service every day?
Your mission
The IT Solution Analyst - Financial Systems has full platform ownership on multiple platforms. He/ She is the sole analyst on these. He/ She ensures its evolution in line with Architects guidance and take care of the effective treatment of incidents enabling seamless operations.
Your duties
- Handle all requests (new functionalities and bugs) coming from business stakeholders ensuring an adequate answer is provided (include arbitrage on whether a development is justified or not) - Support functional requirements definition by guiding business stakeholders to define the best/simpler solution to their needs. - Submit technical architecture to the architects for review and ensure that the architecture guidance is strictly adhered to by the developers - Act as an Agile product owner
- Create user stories (Jira) - Conduct sprint planning and prioritization session - Be the direct (and almost sole) interface to developers - Answer questions and follow-up with developers and business
- Ensure a first layer of integration & functional testing on delivered functionalities and organize detailed testing with relevant business stakeholders - Support production deployment and operations (no on-call) - The IT Solution Analyst - Financial Systems is also expected to define and support the implementation of functional monitoring where needed. - The platforms portfolio that must be covered includes notably all customer’s financial flows: billing, collection, payment management, Account Receivable etc.
What you bring
- A robust technical knowledge is needed (peer-to-peer exchange with developers), this includes notably a perfect command of SQL. - Rational, structured, independent, fast learner - Flexible as work outside of standard working hours is sometime needed - Self-motivated and Solution oriented - Language: French and English needed, German is a plus. - Knowledge of SAP landscape is a plus
Contact
Always dreamed of having a job in a diverse and refreshing environment? Then we really need to meet. Please apply online (we only accept online applications).
Postulez maintenantPostule avec XebooImprimer
job.htmlcontent:
Drucken / als PDF speichern

IT Solution Analyst - Financial Systems

Lieu de travail: RenensTaux d’occupation: 100

Well, we're looking for talented people who share our interests and values. Do you focus on the essential and do what you say? Do you try to make things simple and dare to be original in what you say and do? And most of all, do you excel in providing exceptional service every day?

Your mission

The IT Solution Analyst - Financial Systems has full platform ownership on multiple platforms. He/ She is the sole analyst on these. He/ She ensures its evolution in line with Architects guidance and take care of the effective treatment of incidents enabling seamless operations.

Your duties

  • Handle all requests (new functionalities and bugs) coming from business stakeholders ensuring an adequate answer is provided (include arbitrage on whether a development is justified or not)
  • Support functional requirements definition by guiding business stakeholders to define the best/simpler solution to their needs.
  • Submit technical architecture to the architects for review and ensure that the architecture guidance is strictly adhered to by the developers
  • Act as an Agile product owner
  • Create user stories (Jira)
  • Conduct sprint planning and prioritization session
  • Be the direct (and almost sole) interface to developers
  • Answer questions and follow-up with developers and business
  • Ensure a first layer of integration & functional testing on delivered functionalities and organize detailed testing with relevant business stakeholders
  • Support production deployment and operations (no on-call)
  • The IT Solution Analyst - Financial Systems is also expected to define and support the implementation of functional monitoring where needed.
  • The platforms portfolio that must be covered includes notably all customer’s financial flows: billing, collection, payment management, Account Receivable etc.

What you bring

  • A robust technical knowledge is needed (peer-to-peer exchange with developers), this includes notably a perfect command of SQL.
  • Rational, structured, independent, fast learner
  • Flexible as work outside of standard working hours is sometime needed
  • Self-motivated and Solution oriented
  • Language: French and English needed, German is a plus.
  • Knowledge of SAP landscape is a plus

Contact

Always dreamed of having a job in a diverse and refreshing environment? Then we really need to meet. Please apply online (we only accept online applications).

Assistente Salt Store , di Salt Mobile SA , Sant’antonino
Lieu de travail: Sant'Antonino TITaux d’occupation: 50%
Cerchiamo persone di talento che condividono i nostri valori e interessi.
Vi concentrate sull’essenziale e mantenete le vostre promesse ? Siete in grado di far diventare le cose complicate semplici ? In modo da offrire un servizio eccezionale ogni giorno ?
Vendere e’ la tua grande passione?
Avete la capacita’ di capire le richieste del cliente nelle conversazioni di Vendita ?
Se le competenze richieste corrispondono alle vostre capacita’ avete la possibilita’ ,lavorando in un nostro Salt Store in Ticino , di poterle ulteriormente sviluppare
I vostri compiti:
- Un caloroso benvenuto ai cliente del Salt Store - Consulenza professionale ai Clienti, identificazione delle esigenze , interesse per nuovi servizi / opzioni - Applicare la vendita personalizzata per mostrare ai clienti l’attrattiva delle nostre offerte. - Fare vendite con entusiasmo e convinzione. - Elaborazioni e risoluzioni tecniche - Disponibilita’ e presentazione attraente dei nostri prodotti - Operazione di cassa
Cosa porti con te:
- La formazione professionale completata ,preferibilmente nella vendita al dettaglio, - 1 / 2 anni di esperienza nella vendita e’ preferibile. - Abilita’ tecnica e metodi si lavoro efficienti e precisi. - Buona conoscenza dell’Italiano , ulteriori conoscenze linguistiche costituisce titolo preferenziale. - Persolalita’ aperta , estroversa e socievole. - Il desiderio e la volonta’ di lavorare con successo in un Team. - Piacere nell’apprendimento in un ambiente vivace - E’ richiesta flessibilita’ sull’orario di lavoro.
Avete sempre sognato di lavorare in un ambiente di lavoro entusiasmante, unico e diversificato ?
Allora vogliamo assolutamente conoscerti.
Vi preghiamo di inviarci la candidatura sul nostro sito ONLINE ,( verranno prese in considerazione solo le candidature Online)
Contact
Postulez maintenantPostule avec XebooImprimer

job.title: Salt Store Assistant Wohlen/ Brugg 100%
job.plaincontent:
Drucken / als PDF speichern
Salt Store Assistant Wohlen/ Brugg 100%
Arbeitsplatz: Wohlen/ Brugg
Anstellungsgrad: 100%
Wir suchen nach talentierten Mitarbeitern, die unsere Interessen und Werte teilen. Sie konzentrieren sich auf das Wesentliche und halten, was Sie versprechen? Sie versuchen, Kompliziertes einfach zu machen, und sind unverwechselbar anders, in allem, was Sie sagen und tun? Und am wichtigsten: Sind Sie gut darin, jeden Tag aufs Neue aussergewöhnlichen Service zu bieten?
Ist Verkaufen Ihre grosse Leidenschaft? Besitzen Sie das Einfühlungsvermögen, im Verkaufsgespräch neue Bedürfnisse zu wecken? Wenn JA, bietet sich Ihnen die Möglichkeit, in unserem Salt Store in Brugg und Wohlen Ihr Können einzusetzen und Ihre beruflichen Kompetenzen weiter auszubauen.
Ihre Aufgaben
- Freundliches Willkommen heissen der Salt Store Kunden - Professionelle Beratung der Kunden, Bedürfnisse erkennen, Interesse an neuen Dienstleistungen/Optionen wecken - Anwenden des Pencil Sellings, um den Kunden die Attraktivität unserer Angebote aufzuzeigen - Mit Begeisterung und Ueberzeugung Verkaufsabschlüsse tätigen - Bearbeiten und Lösen von technischen Fragestellungen der Kunden - Mitarbeit bei der attraktiven Präsentation unserer Produkte - Kassenarbeiten
Was sie mitbringen
- Abgeschlossene Berufslehre, vorzugsweise im Detailhand, 1-2 Jahre Verkaufserfahrung von Vorteil - Technisches Flair sowie effiziente und genaue Arbeitsweise - Gute Deutschkenntnisse, weitere Sprachkenntnisse ein Plus - Offene, extrovertierte und kontaktfreudige Persönlichkeit - Wunsch und den Willen, gemeinsam mit dem Team erfolgreich zu sein - Freude am Lernen und einem lebhaften Umfeld - Hohe Flexibilität bezüglich der Arbeitszeiten
Was wir bieten
- faire Löhne - 5 Wochen Ferien - Kostenlose Mobile-Abo’s - Vielseitige Angebote sowie Rabatte auf unsere Produkte
Contact
Sie haben schon immer davon geträumt, in einem erfrischend einzigartigen und vielfältigem Umfeld zu arbeiten? Dann wollen wir Sie unbedingt kennenlernen. Bitte bewerben Sie sich online bei uns (wir berücksichtigen ausschliesslich Online-Bewerbungen).

job.title: Ingénieur 100%
job.plaincontent:
Vos tâches Lors d’une période d’introduction dans notre bureau technique à Dietikon, vous apprendrez à connaître le domaine des travaux souterrains du point de vue de l’entrepreneur. Vous pourrez ensuite mettre en pratique les connaissances acquises en gérant un chantier de travaux souterrains.Exigences requises Vous êtes une personne flexible et capable de travailler en équipe avec
- une formation technique ( EPF, HES ou équivalent ) - intérêt pour le domaine des travaux souterrains - bonnes connaissances de la langue allemande et française ( éventuellement italien ) - connaissances informatiques approfondies - une expérience dans une entreprise ou un bureau d’ingénieur serait un atout
Notre offre Nous vous offrons
- une tâche de conduite intéressante - une activité variée - la collaboration dans une bonne équipe
Entrée en fonction de suite ou à convenirRenseignements Monsieur Philipp Häfliger, responsable travaux souterrains, se tient volontiers à votre disposition pour de plus amples informations ( tél. 044 745 23 11 ).Notre adresse Veuillez adresser votre offre à :
job.htmlcontent:
Vos tâches
Lors d’une période d’introduction dans notre bureau technique à Dietikon, vous apprendrez à connaître le domaine des travaux souterrains du point de vue de l’entrepreneur. Vous pourrez ensuite mettre en pratique les connaissances acquises en gérant un chantier de travaux souterrains.Exigences requises
Vous êtes une personne flexible et capable de travailler en équipe avec
  • une formation technique ( EPF, HES ou équivalent )
  • intérêt pour le domaine des travaux souterrains
  • bonnes connaissances de la langue allemande et française ( éventuellement italien )
  • connaissances informatiques approfondies
  • une expérience dans une entreprise ou un bureau d’ingénieur serait un atout
Notre offre
Nous vous offrons
  • une tâche de conduite intéressante
  • une activité variée
  • la collaboration dans une bonne équipe
Entrée en fonction
de suite ou à convenirRenseignements
Monsieur Philipp Häfliger, responsable travaux souterrains, se tient volontiers à votre disposition pour de plus amples informations ( tél. 044 745 23 11 ).Notre adresse
Veuillez adresser votre offre à :

job.title: Poliere Gussasphalt 100%
job.location: Region Zürich, Ostschweiz, Bern und Basel
job.plaincontent:
Ihre Aufgaben
- Selbständiges Führen von Baustellen - AVOR für zugeteilte Baustellen - Unterstützung des Bauführers in personellen und technischen Belangen - Erstellen von Tages-, Maschinen- und Verschreibungsrapporten sowie Ausmassen - Führen des Baustellenpersonals und Durchsetzung der Arbeitssicherheit
Ihr Profil
- Sie sind gelernter Strassenbauer oder Polybauer - Sie haben fundierte Erfahrung im Führen eines Teams - Sie verfügen über sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift - Sie besitzen den Führerausweis Kategorie B oder BE - Praktische Erfahrung im Gussasphalt ist von Vorteil
Unser Angebot
- Verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben mit hoher Selbständigkeit - Fortschrittliche Arbeitsbedingungen - Weiterbildungs- und Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten
Arbeitsorte
Baustellen in der Region Zürich, Ostschweiz, Bern und Basel
Stellenantritt
sofort oder nach Vereinbarung
Unsere Adresse
Bitte rufen Sie uns für eine unverbindliche Vorabklärung an oder senden uns Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen per E-Mail. Wir danken Ihnen für Ihr Interesse und freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung an:
job.htmlcontent:
Ihre Aufgaben
  • Selbständiges Führen von Baustellen
  • AVOR für zugeteilte Baustellen
  • Unterstützung des Bauführers in personellen und technischen Belangen
  • Erstellen von Tages-, Maschinen- und Verschreibungsrapporten sowie Ausmassen
  • Führen des Baustellenpersonals und Durchsetzung der Arbeitssicherheit
Ihr Profil
  • Sie sind gelernter Strassenbauer oder Polybauer
  • Sie haben fundierte Erfahrung im Führen eines Teams
  • Sie verfügen über sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • Sie besitzen den Führerausweis Kategorie B oder BE
  • Praktische Erfahrung im Gussasphalt ist von Vorteil
Unser Angebot
  • Verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben mit hoher Selbständigkeit
  • Fortschrittliche Arbeitsbedingungen
  • Weiterbildungs- und Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten
Arbeitsorte

Baustellen in der Region Zürich, Ostschweiz, Bern und Basel

Stellenantritt

sofort oder nach Vereinbarung

Unsere Adresse

Bitte rufen Sie uns für eine unverbindliche Vorabklärung an oder senden uns Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen per E-Mail. Wir danken Ihnen für Ihr Interesse und freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung an:

job.title: Polier / Vorarbeiter / Ultra Hochfester Faser Beton 100%
job.plaincontent:
Ihre Aufgaben
- Technisch einwandfreie Abwicklung von Bauwerken mit diesem neuartigen Baustoff - Baustellenspezifische Personalführung
Ihr Profil Sie sind eine teamfähige Persönlichkeit mit entsprechender Ausbildung und folgendem Profil:
- Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung/Leistungsausweis als Baupolier / Vorarbeiter - Praxisorientierte Organisation und Führung von Baustellen sind Ihre Stärken - Unternehmerisches Denken und kostenbewusstes Handeln prägen Ihre Selbstständigkeit - Das Führen von Mitarbeitern ist Ihre Motivation - Ihre Zuverlässigkeit gehört zu Ihren Kernkompetenzen - Versiert im Umgang mit Bauherren und Bauleitungen
Unser Angebot Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit:
- interessanten Baustellen in der ganzen Schweiz - fortschrittliche Arbeitsbedingungen und Sozialleistungen - verantwortungsvollen Aufgaben mit hoher Selbstständigkeit - Mitarbeit in einem motivierten Team
Stellenantritt nach VereinbarungUnsere Adresse Bitte rufen Sie uns für eine unverbindliche Vorabklärung an oder senden uns Ihre Unterlagen per E-Mail. Wir danken Ihnen für Ihr Interesse und freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung an:
job.htmlcontent:
Ihre Aufgaben
  • Technisch einwandfreie Abwicklung von Bauwerken mit diesem neuartigen Baustoff
  • Baustellenspezifische Personalführung
Ihr Profil
Sie sind eine teamfähige Persönlichkeit mit entsprechender Ausbildung und folgendem Profil:
  • Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung/Leistungsausweis als Baupolier / Vorarbeiter
  • Praxisorientierte Organisation und Führung von Baustellen sind Ihre Stärken
  • Unternehmerisches Denken und kostenbewusstes Handeln prägen Ihre Selbstständigkeit
  • Das Führen von Mitarbeitern ist Ihre Motivation
  • Ihre Zuverlässigkeit gehört zu Ihren Kernkompetenzen
  • Versiert im Umgang mit Bauherren und Bauleitungen
Unser Angebot
Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit:
  • interessanten Baustellen in der ganzen Schweiz
  • fortschrittliche Arbeitsbedingungen und Sozialleistungen
  • verantwortungsvollen Aufgaben mit hoher Selbstständigkeit
  • Mitarbeit in einem motivierten Team
Stellenantritt
nach VereinbarungUnsere Adresse
Bitte rufen Sie uns für eine unverbindliche Vorabklärung an oder senden uns Ihre Unterlagen per E-Mail.
Wir danken Ihnen für Ihr Interesse und freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung an:

data.name: Polier
data.phrase: Polier / Vorarbeiter / Ultra Hochfester Faser Beton

job.title: Kauffrau/Kaufmann EFZ Bank (M/E-Profil)
job.plaincontent:
Kauffrau/Kaufmann EFZ Bank (M/E-Profil)
Du suchst eine kaufmännische Lehrstelle, bist an der Bankenwelt interessiert und möchtest in einem familiären Betrieb arbeiten? Dann bist Du bei uns, Rahn + Bodmer Co., der ältesten Zürcher Privatbank, genau richtig. Wir bilden Kaufleute mit erweiterter Grundbildung (E-Profil) und mit Berufsmaturität (M-Profil) aus.
Die berufliche Grundbildung dauert drei Jahre und wird mit dem eidgenössischen Fähigkeitszeugnis abgeschlossen. Während dieser Zeit durchläufst Du mit unserer Unterstützung einige Geschäftsfelder, in welchen die geforderten Bildungsziele abgedeckt werden.
Für den Lehrbeginn im August 2021 haben wir zwei Lehrstellen offen.
Unsere Erwartungen
- Absolventin / Absolvent der Sekundarschule A - Notendurchschnitt in den Hauptfächern (Mathematik, Deutsch, Französisch und Englisch von mindestens 4.5) - Guter Multicheck Kauffrau/-mann E-Profil - Logisches Denkvermögen - Interesse am wirtschaftlichen Geschehen - Einsatzbereitschaft / Teamfähigkeit - Bereitschaft, drei Jahre in eine umfassende Ausbildung zu investieren - Gute Umgangsformen und eine gepflegte Erscheinung
Deine Bewerbung
Wir freuen uns auf Deine individuell gestaltete Bewerbung in elektronischer Form mit folgenden Beilagen:
- Lebenslauf mit Foto - Zeugniskopien der Oberstufe - Multicheck-Resultat Kauffrau/-mann - Stellwerk-Resultat (sofern vorhanden)
Im Bewerbungsschreiben erfahren wir sehr gerne etwas über Deine Person, Deine Gründe zur Berufswahl sowie Deine Motivation, bei uns eine Bankausbildung zu absolvieren.
Möchtest Du Dich bewerben? Dann sende Deine vollständigen Unterlagen per E-Mail an: Rahn+Bodmer Co. Marcia Brunner Postfach 8022 Zürich marcia.brunner@rahnbodmer.ch
Auskunft erhältst Du bei Marcia Brunner, Telefon +41 44 639 16 61. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung und darauf, Dich kennenzulernen.
Zürich, 20. Mai 2020

job.title: Onsite IT Support Analyst
job.plaincontent:
Description
Role purpose
- The Onsite Support Analyst administrates all procedures related to the identification, prioritisation, and resolution of end user requests, including the monitoring, tracking, and coordination of desk-side support functions. The Onsite IT Support Analyst will also contribute to problem resolution by giving in-person, hands-on support to end users at the desk-side support level. - The role forms part of the Tier 1 IT Support team (with Tier 0 being self-service, Tier 1 the Service Desk and Tier 2 and 3 the technical teams).
Main responsibilities
Key responsibilities of this position include:
- Coordinate and/or perform hands-on fixes at the desk-side support level, including installing and upgrading software, installing hardware, implementing file backups, and configuring systems and applications. - Monitor and test fixes to ensure problems have been adequately resolved. - Access software updates, drivers, knowledge bases, and frequently asked questions resources on the Internet to aid in problem resolution. - Perform onsite analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of complex desktop problems for end users, and recommend and implement corrective solutions, including offsite repair for remote users as needed. - Install, configure, test, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot end-user workstations and related hardware and software in order to deliver required desktop service levels. - Where required, administer and resolve issues with associated end-user workstation networking software products. - Receive and respond to incoming calls, pages, and/or e-mails regarding desk-side support problems. - Moving and set up of desktop computers and peripherals. - Answer to and perform moves, adds, and changes requests as they are submitted by line managers. - Prepare tests and applications for monitoring desktop performance, then provide performance statistics and reports. - Assist in preparing, maintaining, and upholding procedures for logging, reporting, and statistically monitoring desktop operations. - Accurately document instances of desktop equipment or component failure, repair, installation, and removal. - The role will also be required to deliver IT induction courses for new joiners. This is as a backup role to the IT Trainer and will only be required to cover the courses during their absence or during major system deployments. - Out of hours scheduled system testing or upgrading. - Any other tasks and projects as required.
Travel requirements: This role requires little travel activity within Switzerland.
About the team
Function Onsite: IT Support Analyst
You will report to: Onsite IT Support Supervisor | Zurich (Head Onsite IT Support Switzerland)
Your direct reports, if any: N/A
Key relationships: Partners and lawyers in Geneva and Zurich; PBS staff members in Geneva and Zurich; Technology colleagues in Specialist and E2E functions
About the candidate
Technical skills, qualifications and experience
- Completed professional education as computer scientist in the direction of systems engineering or a comparable education - At least 5 years of professional experience of providing 1st and 2nd line IT support, preferably in a legal environment - Very good knowledge of Windows 10 / Office 2016 - Excellent technical knowledge of desktop hardware and hands-on hardware troubleshooting experience - Extensive equipment support experience - Well experienced with iOS mobile device management and support - Document Management System (iManage preferred) know-how - Working technical knowledge of current protocols, operating systems, and standards - Service management tool experience - Remote support experience - Very strong customer focus and problem solving skills - Excellent communication skills (French and English, both orally and in writing, German (optional)) - Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize correctly - Ability to present to large groups of people - Ability to operate tools, components, and peripheral accessories
Personal qualities
These personal qualities represent the shared characteristics of high performers across Baker McKenzie, regardless of job level and location.
Know-how
- Keeps across key developments in all relevant areas and demonstrates the ability to develop substantive authority in relation to the Firm's specialist fields. - Demonstrates the ability to identify the real issue, and to anticipate requirements and potential consequences; distils a range of possibilities by thinking in a considered, prudent manner. - Able to move through a variety of tasks requiring different approaches, knowledge, and expertise, with agility of mind and capacity for analysis and synthesis.
Dedication
- Driven by a strong personal sense of integrity and upholds exemplary quality standards. - Prepares thoroughly, takes responsibility, uses initiative and is self-reliant to ensure work progresses to the fullest extent possible. - Hardworking and diligent with a keen understanding of client demands. - Demonstrates composure when dealing with difficult situations.
Personal Impact
- Creates a positive impression at all times; develops relationships through collaboration and reciprocity. - Negotiates to achieve outcomes that are mutually satisfactory; shows good judgement on when to stand strong and when to compromise. - Invests in, nurtures and builds a network of productive relationships.
Humanity
- Respectful to others, regardless of their position, and earns the respect of others by being transparent. - Has care and concern for others and a genuine interest in others as people. - Treats delicate or confidential issues with grace and discretion.
Apply
Regions
- Europe, Middle East and Africa
Locations
- Switzerland
Offices
- Geneva
job.htmlcontent:
Description

Role purpose

  • The Onsite Support Analyst administrates all procedures related to the identification, prioritisation, and resolution of end user requests, including the monitoring, tracking, and coordination of desk-side support functions. The Onsite IT Support Analyst will also contribute to problem resolution by giving in-person, hands-on support to end users at the desk-side support level.
  • The role forms part of the Tier 1 IT Support team (with Tier 0 being self-service, Tier 1 the Service Desk and Tier 2 and 3 the technical teams).

Main responsibilities

Key responsibilities of this position include:

  • Coordinate and/or perform hands-on fixes at the desk-side support level, including installing and upgrading software, installing hardware, implementing file backups, and configuring systems and applications.
  • Monitor and test fixes to ensure problems have been adequately resolved.
  • Access software updates, drivers, knowledge bases, and frequently asked questions resources on the Internet to aid in problem resolution.
  • Perform onsite analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of complex desktop problems for end users, and recommend and implement corrective solutions, including offsite repair for remote users as needed.
  • Install, configure, test, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot end-user workstations and related hardware and software in order to deliver required desktop service levels.
  • Where required, administer and resolve issues with associated end-user workstation networking software products.
  • Receive and respond to incoming calls, pages, and/or e-mails regarding desk-side support problems.
  • Moving and set up of desktop computers and peripherals.
  • Answer to and perform moves, adds, and changes requests as they are submitted by line managers.
  • Prepare tests and applications for monitoring desktop performance, then provide performance statistics and reports.
  • Assist in preparing, maintaining, and upholding procedures for logging, reporting, and statistically monitoring desktop operations.
  • Accurately document instances of desktop equipment or component failure, repair, installation, and removal.
  • The role will also be required to deliver IT induction courses for new joiners. This is as a backup role to the IT Trainer and will only be required to cover the courses during their absence or during major system deployments.
  • Out of hours scheduled system testing or upgrading.
  • Any other tasks and projects as required.

Travel requirements: This role requires little travel activity within Switzerland.

About the team

Function Onsite: IT Support Analyst

You will report to: Onsite IT Support Supervisor | Zurich (Head Onsite IT Support Switzerland)

Your direct reports, if any: N/A

Key relationships: Partners and lawyers in Geneva and Zurich; PBS staff members in Geneva and Zurich; Technology colleagues in Specialist and E2E functions

About the candidate

Technical skills, qualifications and experience

  • Completed professional education as computer scientist in the direction of systems engineering or a comparable education
  • At least 5 years of professional experience of providing 1st and 2nd line IT support, preferably in a legal environment
  • Very good knowledge of Windows 10 / Office 2016
  • Excellent technical knowledge of desktop hardware and hands-on hardware troubleshooting experience
  • Extensive equipment support experience
  • Well experienced with iOS mobile device management and support
  • Document Management System (iManage preferred) know-how
  • Working technical knowledge of current protocols, operating systems, and standards
  • Service management tool experience
  • Remote support experience
  • Very strong customer focus and problem solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills (French and English, both orally and in writing, German (optional))
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize correctly
  • Ability to present to large groups of people
  • Ability to operate tools, components, and peripheral accessories

Personal qualities

These personal qualities represent the shared characteristics of high performers across Baker McKenzie, regardless of job level and location.

Know-how

  • Keeps across key developments in all relevant areas and demonstrates the ability to develop substantive authority in relation to the Firm's specialist fields.
  • Demonstrates the ability to identify the real issue, and to anticipate requirements and potential consequences; distils a range of possibilities by thinking in a considered, prudent manner.
  • Able to move through a variety of tasks requiring different approaches, knowledge, and expertise, with agility of mind and capacity for analysis and synthesis.

Dedication

  • Driven by a strong personal sense of integrity and upholds exemplary quality standards.
  • Prepares thoroughly, takes responsibility, uses initiative and is self-reliant to ensure work progresses to the fullest extent possible.
  • Hardworking and diligent with a keen understanding of client demands.
  • Demonstrates composure when dealing with difficult situations.

Personal Impact

  • Creates a positive impression at all times; develops relationships through collaboration and reciprocity.
  • Negotiates to achieve outcomes that are mutually satisfactory; shows good judgement on when to stand strong and when to compromise.
  • Invests in, nurtures and builds a network of productive relationships.

Humanity

  • Respectful to others, regardless of their position, and earns the respect of others by being transparent.
  • Has care and concern for others and a genuine interest in others as people.
  • Treats delicate or confidential issues with grace and discretion.
Apply

Regions

  • Europe, Middle East and Africa

Locations

  • Switzerland

Offices

  • Geneva

job.title: Management Training Programm 40 - 50% (m/w)
job.plaincontent:
Forbo ist ein führender Hersteller von Bodenbelägen, Bauklebstoffen sowie Antriebs- und Leichtfördertechnik. Das Unternehmen beschäftigt über 5 600 Mitarbeitende und verfügt über ein internationales Netz von 25 Standorten mit Produktion und Vertrieb, 6 Konfektionierungszentren sowie 48 reinen Vertriebsgesellschaften in weltweit insgesamt 38 Ländern. Der jährliche Nettoumsatz beträgt rund CHF 1 282 Mio.
Für unsere Konzernzentrale in Baar suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine flexible und integre Person in der Verantwortlichkeit für unser
Management Training Programm 40 – 50% (m/w)
In dieser Position berichten Sie an den Head Corporate Human Resources. Sie sind für die Organisation, Durchführung und Nachbearbeitung unserer internationalen Management Schulungswochen verantwortlich und helfen, diese in der Zusammenarbeit mit unserem externen Partner weiterzuentwickeln. Zusätzlich betreuen Sie die entsprechende Lernplattform für die Schulungsteilnehmer.
Sie verfügen über einen betriebswirtschaftlichen Hintergrund (Universität, FH) und haben einige Jahre vergleichbare Berufserfahrung in einem ähnlichen Umfeld. Sie sind bewandert im Umgang mit den gängigen Microsoft-Applikationen, bringen sehr gute schriftliche und mündliche Englischkenntnisse mit und verständigen sich stilsicher in der deutschen Sprache. Wir wenden uns an eine organisationsstarke Persönlichkeit, die gerne gewissenhaft, dienstleistungsorientiert und antizipativ arbeitet. Mit Ihrer ausgeprägten Kommunikationsfähigkeit und hohen Sozialkompetenz sowie Ihrer selbständigen Arbeitsweise sorgen Sie für professionelle Dienstleistungen in Ihrem Zuständigkeitsbereich. Sie überzeugen aufgrund Ihrer Motivation und sind es gewohnt, lösungsorientiert zu handeln. Flexibilität und die Einhaltung von Deadlines zählen ebenso zu Ihren Stärken wie auch Zuverlässigkeit und Verschwiegenheit. Zur Aufgabe gehört, dass Sie zweimal pro Jahr während der Schulungswochen jeweils eine Woche extern in einer Seminarlokalität in der Schweiz vor Ort die Trainingswoche begleiten.
Sie erhalten die Möglichkeit, Ihre fachlichen und menschlichen Qualitäten in einem internationalen Arbeitsumfeld einzusetzen. Wenn Sie sich als motivierte und engagierte Persönlichkeit in unserem Team einbringen möchten, senden Sie uns Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen.
Diego Salis, Forbo International SA, Lindenstrasse 8 / Postfach 1339, 6341 Baar
diego.salis@forbo.com

job.title: Médiateur-trice scientifique pour Swiss Polar Class

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.htmlcontent:
L’Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), est l’un des campus universitaires les plus dynamiques en Europe et s’inscrit dans le top 20 mondial de nombreux classements académiques. L’EPFL compte près de 6'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs qui font vivre les trois missions principales de l’Ecole : la formation, la recherche et l’innovation. Le campus de l’EPFL offre un cadre de travail exceptionnel au cœur d’une communauté de 16'000 personnes dont plus de 10'000 étudiants et 3500 chercheurs issus de 120 nationalités différentes.

Médiateur-trice scientifique pour Swiss Polar Class

Mission :
Faire la promotion en Suisse alémanique du programme Swiss Polar Class (polar-class.ch), un programme éducatif pour les écoliers de primaire de 8 à 12 ans, et soutenir son développement en contribuant à l’élaboration de nouveaux contenus. Principales tâches et responsabilités :
  • Développer un réseau de contacts en Suisse alémanique afin de faire la promotion du programme et d’y organiser des événements avec des classes d’écoles, des musées d’histoire naturelle et autres vecteurs de diffusion de la science;
  • Contribuer au développement de nouveaux contenus et garantir le support et la traduction du programme en langue allemande.
Profil recherché :
  • Bachelor ou Master en sciences naturelles, de préférence avec de bonnes connaissances sur les questions environnementales et/ou les régions polaires, ou un Bachelor en sciences de l’éducation;
  • Une grande sensibilité pour l’approche scientifique et sa médiation auprès d’un public non-expert;
  • Une grande aisance avec les plus jeunes et l’animation de groupes;
  • De langue maternelle allemande et d’excellentes compétences rédactionnelles allemandes;
  • De bonnes connaissances en anglais et en français;
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et de manière autonome;
  • Excellentes compétences communicatives à l’interne et à l’externe;
  • Expérience dans la gestion de projets de communication scientifique;
  • Flexibilité au niveau des déplacements;
  • Maitrise de base ou volonté à apprendre à travailler sur InDesign et autres outils informatiques.
Nous offrons :
  • La possibilité de travailler au sein d’une équipe motivée;
  • La possibilité de contribuer au développement et à la dissémination du programme Swiss Polar Class;
  • Des conditions d’engagement attractives.
Date d'entrée en fonction :
01.07.2020 ou à convenir Type de contrat :
Durée déterminée (CDD) Taux d'occupation :
20-30% Durée :
12 moisContact :
Des renseignements complémentaires peuvent être obtenus auprès de M. Basil Fahrländer par e-mail à basil.fahrlaender@epfl.ch. Aucune candidature envoyée à cette adresse ne pourra être considérée. Remarque :
Seuls les candidats ayant postulé via le site internet de l'EPFL ou celui de notre partenaire Jobup seront pris en compte.postuler en ligne

job.title: iOS developer 80 - 100% (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
iOS developer 80 - 100% (W/M)
Your mission : Dynamico is an application running on iOS tablets for children with handwriting difficulties. Using machine learning algorithms, Dynamico enables to spot the type of handwriting difficulties and suggests remediation activities targeting these specific difficulties. A monitoring dashboard allows to track the child’s progress.
The CHILI lab is looking for an experienced iOS developer (W/M) to strengthen the development team.
Main duties and responsibilities include : You will be involved in all phases of the development lifecycle, including: - Requirements gathering - Implementation of new features, debugging, testing, deployment - Work with designers - Documentation and code reviews Your profile : - You have a proven record of developing and releasing apps or games on the App Store - You are fluent in English or French
Essential skills / technologies required: - Swift - UIKit - git - Unit testing - Good team player
Considered a plus: - Experience developing games - Machine learning - Agile development - Firebase - Python
We offer : Working on a great app for helping children facing school difficulties, a start-up will be launched in a couple of months). Working in a great lab with researchers from all over the world, and located in the Rolex Learning Center Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Work rate : 80 - 100%% Duration : 1 year, renewable Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Team leader e/o addetto alla produzione con funzioni gestionali
job.plaincontent:
Team leader e/o addetto alla produzione
Siamo un’azienda tessile, dinamica e di successo e per la nostra lavanderia di Sementina siamo alla ricerca, per assunzione immediata o da convenire, di un
Team leader e/o addetto alla produzione con funzioni gestionali (u/d) 100%
In questa Sua funzione ci garantisce la consegna puntuale della biancheria giusta, completa e in condizioni ineccepibili presso la clientela.
Mansioni
- Pianificazione delle attività e gestione di un team di 25 dipendenti - Responsabilità nel processo di produzione dal ricevimento della merce alla riconsegna al cliente incluso le modalità di spedizione - Avvio di misure immediate in caso di guasti alle macchine e/o veicoli (inclusa la manutenzione del parco macchine) - collaborazione nella produzione
Requisiti
- Diversi anni di esperienza professionale in una posizione manageriale, possibilmente anche in un’azienda di lavanderia - Di madrelingua italiana con buone conoscenze della lingua tedesca (parlato e scritto) indispensabile - Conoscenze informatiche al livello medio - Alta automotivazione e volontà di agire - Leadership forte ed entusiasta - Personalità comunicativa - Capacità tecniche ed organizzative - Disponibilità' di adattamento alle fluttuazioni stagionali a livello lavorativo (di tanto in tanto é richiesto il lavoro a turni) - Tragitto lavorativo breve
Offriamo un’attività varia ed interessante in un ambiente lavorativo, impegnativo e di alta operatività.
Ulteriori informazioni al riguardo saranno fornite dalla Sig.ra Gaby Angelella, T 079 774 10 88.
Se risponde ai requisiti elencati attendiamo con piacere la relativa candidatura completa di CV e copie dei certificati all'indirizzo riportato qui di seguito.

job.htmlcontent:
Team leader e/o addetto alla produzione

Siamo un’azienda tessile, dinamica e di successo e per la nostra lavanderia di Sementina siamo alla ricerca, per assunzione immediata o da convenire, di un

Team leader e/o addetto alla produzione con funzioni gestionali(u/d) 100%

In questa Sua funzione ci garantisce la consegna puntuale della biancheria giusta, completa e in condizioni ineccepibili presso la clientela.

Mansioni

  • Pianificazione delle attività e gestione di un team di 25 dipendenti
  • Responsabilità nel processo di produzione dal ricevimento della merce alla riconsegna al cliente incluso le modalità di spedizione
  • Avvio di misure immediate in caso di guasti alle macchine e/o veicoli (inclusa la manutenzione del parco macchine)
  • collaborazione nella produzione

Requisiti

  • Diversi anni di esperienza professionale in una posizione manageriale, possibilmente anche in un’azienda di lavanderia
  • Di madrelingua italiana con buone conoscenze della lingua tedesca (parlato e scritto) indispensabile
  • Conoscenze informatiche al livello medio
  • Alta automotivazione e volontà di agire
  • Leadership forte ed entusiasta
  • Personalità comunicativa
  • Capacità tecniche ed organizzative
  • Disponibilità' di adattamento alle fluttuazioni stagionali a livello lavorativo (di tanto in tanto é richiesto il lavoro a turni)
  • Tragitto lavorativo breve

 

Offriamo un’attività varia ed interessante in un ambiente lavorativo, impegnativo e di alta operatività.

Als Teil der Lehmann Familiengruppe sind wir als spezialisierter Silo- und Anlagenbauer für den Strassenwinterdienst tätig. Zunehmend stehen bei uns der komplette Anlagenbau und die moderne Fördertechnik im Fokus. Europaweit realisieren wir individuelle und wirtschaftliche Lösungen, die wir zusammen mit unseren Kunden entwickeln, in unserem Werk produzie- ren und vor Ort montieren. Ihre Herausforderung In dieser Funktion unterstützen Sie unseren verant- wortlichen Mitarbeiter in Deutschland bei Akquisitionen, bei der Kunden- betreuung sowie beim Angebotswesen und in der Nachkalkulation. Neben den Büroaufgaben sind Sie mit Abbundarbeiten, Montagearbeiten sowie Werkmontagearbeiten beschäftigt und es macht Ihnen nichts aus, auf Aus- wärtsmontagen (mehrmals pro Jahr) tätig zu sein. job.title: Apple CH-Operations Expert (m/f/d)
job.plaincontent:
Key Qualifications
Key Qualifications
- Ability to think quickly and perform problem-solving tasks, even within changing conditions. - Leadership skills, whether guiding by example or coaching a group. - Strong organizational skills, quickly directing order in every situation.
Description
DescriptionAs an Operations Expert, you and your team have the incredible responsibility of ensuring products take the final step in the supply chain: getting into customers' hands. You're in charge of the store's entire inventory - products, parts, tools, supplies, and everything else. You make sure your team has the support, knowledge, and resources required to maintain product availability, complete inventory tasks, and keep the stockroom organized as new products arrive. You're in constant contact with the management and leadership teams, sharing data about the status of products and parts. And when exciting new products arrive, you're the first to open them up and present them to the entire store team. Apple makes the products, but you make it happen by being ready to place our products in customers' hands.
Education & Experience
Education & Experience
Additional Requirements
Additional Requirements
- • You can manage and meet multiple inventory deadlines each week. - • You’re willing to observe guidelines to allow secure access to products and movement through the stockroom. - • You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.
job.htmlcontent:
Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
  • Ability to think quickly and perform problem-solving tasks, even within changing conditions.
  • Leadership skills, whether guiding by example or coaching a group.
  • Strong organizational skills, quickly directing order in every situation.

Description

DescriptionAs an Operations Expert, you and your team have the incredible responsibility of ensuring products take the final step in the supply chain: getting into customers' hands. You're in charge of the store's entire inventory - products, parts, tools, supplies, and everything else. You make sure your team has the support, knowledge, and resources required to maintain product availability, complete inventory tasks, and keep the stockroom organized as new products arrive. You're in constant contact with the management and leadership teams, sharing data about the status of products and parts. And when exciting new products arrive, you're the first to open them up and present them to the entire store team. Apple makes the products, but you make it happen by being ready to place our products in customers' hands.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements
  • • You can manage and meet multiple inventory deadlines each week.
  • • You’re willing to observe guidelines to allow secure access to products and movement through the stockroom.
  • • You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.

job.title: Apple CH-Business Expert (m/f/d)
job.plaincontent:
Key Qualifications
Key Qualifications
- Understanding of how businesses use technology and what Apple solutions can offer them. - Comfort using the phone to interact with customers and to position business solutions. - Ability to facilitate business experiences through in-store briefings, workshops, and events.
Description
DescriptionAs a Business Expert, you introduce Apple solutions, technology, and services to business customers. You spend time on the sales floor, meeting first-time and current business customers and learning their needs. You generate new leads and build relationships, connecting over the phone or through in-store workshops and events. You discover customer needs through briefings and work with the Business Team to prepare and present proposals. For customers with more complex needs, you work with the entire Business Team to craft the ideal solutions. Finally, you inform and offer customers the complete suite of sales support options. By engaging customers to think about the possibilities of Apple technology in their businesses, you help build success - not only for your team, but for our customers as well.
Education & Experience
Education & Experience
Additional Requirements
Additional Requirements
- • You have experience selling in the business market. - • You’re comfortable developing qualified leads by phone. - • You have strong people and presentation skills, and excellent written and verbal communication skills. - • You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.
job.htmlcontent:
Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
  • Understanding of how businesses use technology and what Apple solutions can offer them.
  • Comfort using the phone to interact with customers and to position business solutions.
  • Ability to facilitate business experiences through in-store briefings, workshops, and events.

Description

DescriptionAs a Business Expert, you introduce Apple solutions, technology, and services to business customers. You spend time on the sales floor, meeting first-time and current business customers and learning their needs. You generate new leads and build relationships, connecting over the phone or through in-store workshops and events. You discover customer needs through briefings and work with the Business Team to prepare and present proposals. For customers with more complex needs, you work with the entire Business Team to craft the ideal solutions. Finally, you inform and offer customers the complete suite of sales support options. By engaging customers to think about the possibilities of Apple technology in their businesses, you help build success - not only for your team, but for our customers as well.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements
  • • You have experience selling in the business market.
  • • You’re comfortable developing qualified leads by phone.
  • • You have strong people and presentation skills, and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • • You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.

job.title: Apple CH-Store Leader (m/f/d)
job.plaincontent:
Key Qualifications
Key Qualifications
- Proven ability to drive positive customer experiences that build loyalty and deliver measurable results. - Ability to manage separate business groups within a complex environment. - Strong communication skills to clearly impart the Apple vision to the teams you oversee.
Description
DescriptionAs a Store Leader, you inspire teams to deliver measurable results for the store's various business sectors. You lead a sales force that discovers customers' needs and delivers solutions to build Apple loyalty. Your technical support team helps maintain customers' trust in Apple and its products. Your business team brings the Apple experience to business customers. And the training staff you coach teaches customers how to get the most out of their Apple products. You build these lines of business by selecting and developing a knowledgeable talent pool. In addition to team building, you create excitement around products, launches, programs, and initiatives. You're responsible for upholding our high standards regarding communication and confidentiality. And by driving your staff to create customer experiences that enhance Apple loyalty, you deliver measurable results and help enrich customers' lives.
Education & Experience
Education & Experience
Additional Requirements
Additional Requirements
- • You have demonstrated leadership ability with experience in a customer-facing sales setting. - • Cross-industry experience is welcome — a retail background is not necessary. - • You have a passion for learning about Apple technology and products. - • You read, write and speak English fluently. - • You are flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.
job.htmlcontent:
Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
  • Proven ability to drive positive customer experiences that build loyalty and deliver measurable results.
  • Ability to manage separate business groups within a complex environment.
  • Strong communication skills to clearly impart the Apple vision to the teams you oversee.

Description

DescriptionAs a Store Leader, you inspire teams to deliver measurable results for the store's various business sectors. You lead a sales force that discovers customers' needs and delivers solutions to build Apple loyalty. Your technical support team helps maintain customers' trust in Apple and its products. Your business team brings the Apple experience to business customers. And the training staff you coach teaches customers how to get the most out of their Apple products. You build these lines of business by selecting and developing a knowledgeable talent pool. In addition to team building, you create excitement around products, launches, programs, and initiatives. You're responsible for upholding our high standards regarding communication and confidentiality. And by driving your staff to create customer experiences that enhance Apple loyalty, you deliver measurable results and help enrich customers' lives.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements
  • • You have demonstrated leadership ability with experience in a customer-facing sales setting.
  • • Cross-industry experience is welcome — a retail background is not necessary.
  • • You have a passion for learning about Apple technology and products.
  • • You read, write and speak English fluently.
  • • You are flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.

job.title: Apple CH-Senior Manager (m/f/d)
job.plaincontent:
Key Qualifications
Key Qualifications
- Ability to collaborate with the store leadership team to develop strategic plans across multiple business groups, improving process and surpassing standards to drive the business in the store - Proven ability to inspire, coach, train, and develop store team members to consistently provide exceptional customer service and drive for results - Experience adapting to challenges, providing support, and guiding communications in a constantly changing retail environment
Description
DescriptionAs a Senior Manager, you guide other leaders to inspire top performance from their teams. You monitor multiple lines of business within the store to achieve operational objectives and collaborate with corporate business partners to report results. You’re knowledgeable about the industry and keep up to date about competitors and trends. You lead the sales and customer support teams by example, finding solutions to create and maintain a high level of customer focus. To foster growth among your staff, you coach and encourage with clear communications. By developing strong relationships across teams and with customers, you create an environment that enhances loyalty for Apple products and services.
Education & Experience
Education & Experience
Additional Requirements
Additional Requirements
- • You have demonstrated leadership ability with at least five years of experience in a customer-facing sales setting. - • Cross-industry experience is welcome — a retail background is not necessary. - • You have a passion for learning about Apple technology and products. - • You’re fluent in English (both written and spoken) and the local language. Multilingual ability is a plus. - • You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.
job.htmlcontent:
Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
  • Ability to collaborate with the store leadership team to develop strategic plans across multiple business groups, improving process and surpassing standards to drive the business in the store
  • Proven ability to inspire, coach, train, and develop store team members to consistently provide exceptional customer service and drive for results
  • Experience adapting to challenges, providing support, and guiding communications in a constantly changing retail environment

Description

DescriptionAs a Senior Manager, you guide other leaders to inspire top performance from their teams. You monitor multiple lines of business within the store to achieve operational objectives and collaborate with corporate business partners to report results. You’re knowledgeable about the industry and keep up to date about competitors and trends. You lead the sales and customer support teams by example, finding solutions to create and maintain a high level of customer focus. To foster growth among your staff, you coach and encourage with clear communications. By developing strong relationships across teams and with customers, you create an environment that enhances loyalty for Apple products and services.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements
  • • You have demonstrated leadership ability with at least five years of experience in a customer-facing sales setting.
  • • Cross-industry experience is welcome — a retail background is not necessary.
  • • You have a passion for learning about Apple technology and products.
  • • You’re fluent in English (both written and spoken) and the local language. Multilingual ability is a plus.
  • • You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.

job.title: Enterprise Carrier Executive
job.plaincontent:
Key Qualifications
Key Qualifications
- No matter the audience, you are a specialist at presenting. And, you’re cool under pressure. You make the complex simple and you command an audience by bringing them along for the journey. You empower others to learn, to be curious and ultimately, share your passion for the Apple story. - When challenged with complex questions, you share your deep knowledge of how our hardware, software and services integrate. - Apple doesn’t cut corners, in products or in business. You bring the highest level of integrity, honesty, and accountability in all that you do, every single day. You are a trusted advisor who does what you say you’ll do – and always does what’s best for Apple. - Customer and partner needs can often be unique – but, you’re quick on your feet and connect and influence the right people both inside and outside of Apple. As a go to person with leadership, you are trusted and comfortable in tough situations. You can settle disputes, negotiations and own the hard calls with minimal noise. You step up to conflicts and see them as opportunities to shine. - You believe that communication is key to Apple’s success. You’re a dreamer and someone who actively talks and listens through endless possibilities – with customers and teammates alike. To ensure the most innovative ideas become a reality, you recognize perspectives, patiently listen to every detail and commit to what is right, in order to move us forward. - You know yourself – you have strengths, weaknesses and opportunities - but you also know the people around you and are open to their feedback. You relate well to all kinds of people – up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization. When faced with a challenging opportunity, you know who to connect with and when. People know you as a true collaborator who knows what it takes to win. - Apple and third party solutions solve complex business problems in simple and innovative ways. You create competitive and breakthrough strategies that truly shape the future. You do this by asking why and why not, both stripping out what is not essential and identifying what is. By doing so, you are able to see what’s ahead and identify trends that will be critical for growth. - You strive for excellence in everything you do. Due to changing priorities, urgent customer needs, or a final push to meet a quarterly forecast, you face the daily challenge of where to focus your time and energy. You have a don’t give up attitude, and finish, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks. You seize every opportunity and empower others to reach their goals along the way. - You adapt to change and find the right path without necessarily having all of the pieces to the puzzle. At Apple, things aren’t always clear but you shift gears and thrive when asked to explore new ground, rather than waiting on others.
Description
DescriptionWe partner closely with our carrier partner’s sales force to capture their hearts and minds for Apple’s ecosystem through training, tools, and programs to grow the iPhone and iPad business in our territory. We work collaboratively by connecting our carrier partners, enterprise customers, and the rest of Apple with our strategic solutions partners and other third party developers to create technical solutions for business transformation. Through the partnership, we identify new, B2B opportunities and support them through closure. We make certain that any client issues and/or concerns are raised and addressed. We share status, progress and facilitate sales activity across the carrier, customer and Apple sales teams.
Education & Experience
Education & ExperienceYou have consultative selling experience in business transformation solutions and developing channel growth strategies for business customers. In your experience, you’ve balanced delivering on short-term goals, while creating sustainable value for customers and partners, and demand for the future. Or you bring extensive of experience as an Account Executive for a mobile device company with knowledge of service providers. You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education.
Additional Requirements
Additional Requirements
- Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.
job.htmlcontent:
Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
  • No matter the audience, you are a specialist at presenting. And, you’re cool under pressure. You make the complex simple and you command an audience by bringing them along for the journey. You empower others to learn, to be curious and ultimately, share your passion for the Apple story.
  • When challenged with complex questions, you share your deep knowledge of how our hardware, software and services integrate.
  • Apple doesn’t cut corners, in products or in business. You bring the highest level of integrity, honesty, and accountability in all that you do, every single day. You are a trusted advisor who does what you say you’ll do – and always does what’s best for Apple.
  • Customer and partner needs can often be unique – but, you’re quick on your feet and connect and influence the right people both inside and outside of Apple. As a go to person with leadership, you are trusted and comfortable in tough situations. You can settle disputes, negotiations and own the hard calls with minimal noise. You step up to conflicts and see them as opportunities to shine.
  • You believe that communication is key to Apple’s success. You’re a dreamer and someone who actively talks and listens through endless possibilities – with customers and teammates alike. To ensure the most innovative ideas become a reality, you recognize perspectives, patiently listen to every detail and commit to what is right, in order to move us forward.
  • You know yourself – you have strengths, weaknesses and opportunities - but you also know the people around you and are open to their feedback. You relate well to all kinds of people – up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization. When faced with a challenging opportunity, you know who to connect with and when. People know you as a true collaborator who knows what it takes to win.
  • Apple and third party solutions solve complex business problems in simple and innovative ways. You create competitive and breakthrough strategies that truly shape the future. You do this by asking why and why not, both stripping out what is not essential and identifying what is. By doing so, you are able to see what’s ahead and identify trends that will be critical for growth.
  • You strive for excellence in everything you do. Due to changing priorities, urgent customer needs, or a final push to meet a quarterly forecast, you face the daily challenge of where to focus your time and energy. You have a don’t give up attitude, and finish, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks. You seize every opportunity and empower others to reach their goals along the way.
  • You adapt to change and find the right path without necessarily having all of the pieces to the puzzle. At Apple, things aren’t always clear but you shift gears and thrive when asked to explore new ground, rather than waiting on others.

Description

DescriptionWe partner closely with our carrier partner’s sales force to capture their hearts and minds for Apple’s ecosystem through training, tools, and programs to grow the iPhone and iPad business in our territory. We work collaboratively by connecting our carrier partners, enterprise customers, and the rest of Apple with our strategic solutions partners and other third party developers to create technical solutions for business transformation. Through the partnership, we identify new, B2B opportunities and support them through closure. We make certain that any client issues and/or concerns are raised and addressed. We share status, progress and facilitate sales activity across the carrier, customer and Apple sales teams.

Education & Experience

Education & ExperienceYou have consultative selling experience in business transformation solutions and developing channel growth strategies for business customers. In your experience, you’ve balanced delivering on short-term goals, while creating sustainable value for customers and partners, and demand for the future. Or you bring extensive of experience as an Account Executive for a mobile device company with knowledge of service providers. You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education.

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements
  • Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

job.title: Projektleiter Kunstbauten (w/m)
job.plaincontent:
Unternehmensbeschreibung
Gruner mit Hauptsitz in Basel steht für qualitativ massgebende Baudienstleistungen. Vor über 150 Jahren gegründet, zählt Gruner heute über 30 Standorte in der Schweiz und weltweit. Kompetenz, Fachwissen und langjährige Erfahrung mit komplexen Bauvorhaben im In- und Ausland zeichnen die Gruner aus.
Stellenbeschreibung
- Leitung von Projekten im Bereich Brücken- und Kunstbauten - Verantwortung für die technische Leitung, die Überwachung sowie Steuerung der Kosten, Termine und Qualität - Koordination und Kommunikation mit Kunden
Qualifikationen
- Dipl. Bauing. FH/ETH - Mind. 5 Jahre Erfahrung im konstruktiven Ingenieurbau / Brückenbau - Gute Kenntnisse der CH-Normen - Kompetentes und sicheres Auftreten, kommunikativ, verhandlungssicher und belastbar - Strukturierte und selbständige Arbeitsweise - Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse, Französischkenntnisse von Vorteil - Bereitschaft Projektleitungen im Grossraum Zürich und in der Innerschweiz wahrzunehmen
Zusätzliche Informationen
Gruner bietet den Mitarbeitenden das Beste aus zwei Welten: Dynamik und Kollegialität in einem überschaubaren Arbeitsumfeld, Sicherheit und Professionalität eines grossen Unternehmens. job.htmlcontent:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Gruner mit Hauptsitz in Basel steht für qualitativ massgebende Baudienstleistungen. Vor über 150 Jahren gegründet, zählt Gruner heute über 30 Standorte in der Schweiz und weltweit. Kompetenz, Fachwissen und langjährige Erfahrung mit komplexen Bauvorhaben im In- und Ausland zeichnen die Gruner aus.  

Stellenbeschreibung

  • Leitung von Projekten im Bereich Brücken- und Kunstbauten
  • Verantwortung für die technische Leitung, die Überwachung sowie Steuerung der Kosten, Termine und Qualität
  • Koordination und Kommunikation mit Kunden

Qualifikationen

  • Dipl. Bauing. FH/ETH
  • Mind. 5 Jahre Erfahrung im konstruktiven Ingenieurbau / Brückenbau
  • Gute Kenntnisse der CH-Normen
  • Kompetentes und sicheres Auftreten, kommunikativ, verhandlungssicher und belastbar
  • Strukturierte und selbständige Arbeitsweise
  • Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse, Französischkenntnisse von Vorteil
  • Bereitschaft Projektleitungen im Grossraum Zürich und in der Innerschweiz wahrzunehmen

job.title: Chef de département, Chef de projet Senior
job.plaincontent:
Description de l'entreprise
Stucky SA, membre du groupe Gruner, est une société d’ingénieurs internationale spécialisée dans les domaines de l’énergie, de l’eau, des infrastructures et des bâtiments. Stucky a réalisé plus d’une centaine d’aménagements hydroélectriques dans le monde, en particulier des barrages, des centrales hydroélectriques, des postes et des lignes électriques à haute et très haute tension, des adductions d’eau potable. La société est également active dans le domaine des infrastructures ferroviaires et routiers (gare, ponts, tunnels) et des bâtiments (structure porteuse, fondations, technique de bâtiment).
Le bureau principal de Stucky est situé à Renens (Suisse). Stucky dispose de succursales à Fribourg et Martigny et de filiales en Serbie et Géorgie.
Description du poste
- Conduite d’une équipe d’ingénieurs civils et dessinateurs - Gestion de projets d’envergure en suisse et à l’étranger - Conception et supervision des projets dans les phases d'études et d'exécution - Prospection, préparation des offres dans le domaine hydroélectrique et barrages
Qualifications
- Diplôme d’ingénieur civil, EPF ou HES - Expérience dans la conduite de personnel - Bonnes relations avec les clients et partenaires, disposant d'un solide réseau professionnel en Suisse et à l’étranger - Expérience dans la gestion de grands projets à l’étranger - Expérience à l’international, prêt à partir pour de courtes missions à l’étranger - Chef de grands projets confirmé avec 15 ans d’experience (références en Suisse et/ou à l’étranger obligatoires) - Chef de grands projets pluridisciplinaires confirmé - Maîtrise du français, de l’anglais (niveau B2 minimum)
Informations complémentaires
Stucky offre aux employés : dynamisme et collégialité dans un environnement de travail agréable et professionnel. En tant qu'employeur attractif, nous vous offrons des conditions de travail modernes, des avantages sociaux intéressants, des projets stimulants et des possibilités d'évolution de carrière.
Suivez-nous sur LinkedIn, YouTube ou abonnez-vous à la lettre d'information sur l'emploi.

Description de l'entreprise

Stucky SA, membre du groupe Gruner, est une société d’ingénieurs internationale spécialisée dans les domaines de l’énergie, de l’eau, des infrastructures et des bâtiments. Stucky a réalisé plus d’une centaine d’aménagements hydroélectriques dans le monde, en particulier des barrages, des centrales hydroélectriques, des postes et des lignes électriques à haute et très haute tension, des adductions d’eau potable. La société est également active dans le domaine des infrastructures ferroviaires et routiers (gare, ponts, tunnels) et des bâtiments (structure porteuse, fondations, technique de bâtiment).

Le bureau principal de Stucky est situé à Renens (Suisse). Stucky dispose de succursales à Fribourg et Martigny et de filiales en Serbie et Géorgie.

Description du poste

  • Conduite d’une équipe d’ingénieurs civils et dessinateurs
  • Gestion de projets d’envergure en suisse et à l’étranger
  • Conception et supervision des projets dans les phases d'études et d'exécution
  • Prospection, préparation des offres dans le domaine hydroélectrique et barrages

Qualifications

  • Diplôme d’ingénieur civil, EPF ou HES
  • Expérience dans la conduite de personnel
  • Bonnes relations avec les clients et partenaires, disposant d'un solide réseau professionnel en Suisse et à l’étranger
  • Expérience dans la gestion de grands projets à l’étranger
  • Expérience à l’international, prêt à partir pour de courtes missions à l’étranger
  • Chef de grands projets confirmé avec 15 ans d’experience (références en Suisse et/ou à l’étranger obligatoires)
  • Chef de grands projets pluridisciplinaires confirmé
  • Maîtrise du français, de l’anglais (niveau B2 minimum)

Informations complémentaires

job.title: Dessinateur/Technicien en Génie Civil
job.plaincontent:
Description de l'entreprise
Stucky SA, membre du groupe Gruner, est une société d’ingénieurs internationale spécialisée dans les domaines de l’énergie, de l’eau, des infrastructures et des bâtiments. Stucky a réalisé plus d’une centaine d’aménagements hydroélectriques dans le monde, en particulier des barrages, des centrales hydroélectriques, des postes et des lignes électriques à haute et très haute tension, des adductions d’eau potable. La société est également active dans le domaine des infrastructures ferroviaires et routiers (gare, ponts, tunnels) et des bâtiments (structure porteuse, fondations, technique de bâtiment).
Le bureau principal de Stucky est situé à Renens (Suisse). Stucky dispose de succursales à Fribourg et Martigny et de filiales en Serbie et Géorgie.
Description du poste
- Assurer l’exécution de plans de manière autonome sur la base d’esquisses - Concevoir des variantes de projets sur la base d’analyse sur Civil 3D/revit - Participer à la formation des apprentis
Qualifications

job.title: Dessinateur en Génie Civil
job.plaincontent:
Description de l'entreprise
Stucky SA, membre du groupe Gruner, est une société d’ingénieurs internationale spécialisée dans les domaines de l’énergie, de l’eau, des infrastructures et des bâtiments. Stucky a réalisé plus d’une centaine d’aménagements hydroélectriques dans le monde, en particulier des barrages, des centrales hydroélectriques, des postes et des lignes électriques à haute et très haute tension, des adductions d’eau potable, des infrastructures ferroviaires.
Le bureau principal de Stucky est situé à Renens, nous avons également un bureau à Fribourg et à Martigny. Stucky vous offre des opportunités de carrière intéressantes dans un environnement dynamique et multiculturel.
Description du poste
- Assurer l’exécution de plans de manière autonome sur la base d’esquisses et de schémas - Assurer des contrôles sur les chantiers (établissement de métrés, contrôle des armatures, …) - Participer à l’établissement des documents délivrables et des soumissions - Appuyer l’équipe de projet dans la conception des infrastructures routières, ferroviaires et dans les projets de structure
Qualifications
- Expérience en projets routiers et de structure - Minimum 3 à 5 ans d’expérience confirmée dans un bureau d’étude Suisse - CFC ou titre jugé équivalent de dessinateur en génie civil - Maîtrise des outils : Office et Messerli - Maîtrise des logiciels de dessin : Bacad, Civil 3D, Autocad, une maitrise de REVIT est un atout - Maîtrise du français, l’anglais et l’allemand seraient un plus
Informations complémentaires

job.title: Fachbauleiter Gebäudetechnik (w/m) 80 - 100%
job.plaincontent:
Unternehmensbeschreibung
Gruner mit Hauptsitz in Basel steht für qualitativ massgebende Baudienstleistungen. Vor über 150 Jahren gegründet, zählt Gruner heute über 30 Standorte in der Schweiz und weltweit. Kompetenz, Fachwissen und langjährige Erfahrung mit komplexen Bauvorhaben im In- und Ausland zeichnen die Gruner aus.
Stellenbeschreibung
- Projektmanagement Realisierung (Phase 51-53) - Gewerksübergreifende Qualitätssicherung Realisierung - Führung der Unternehmer in der Phase Realisierung - Kosten- und Terminmanagement - Führung / Teilnahme an den Ausführungsbesprechungen mit dem Bauherr, Architekten und Unternehmer - Organisation und Führung der Funktionstest und Inbetriebnahmen - Organisation, Führung und Dokumentation der Abnahmen
Qualifikationen
- Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung als Installateur oder Planer (Weiterbildung zum Meister, HF/TS oder ähnliches von Vorteil) - Mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Bauleitung von mittleren und grösseren Projekten - Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Gebäudetechnik sowie Gute Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement (Interne Weiterbildung möglich) - Kundenorientiert, hohe Sozialkompetenz, Teamplayer - Ziel- und ergebnisorientierte Persönlichkeit

job.htmlcontent:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Gruner mit Hauptsitz in Basel steht für qualitativ massgebende Baudienstleistungen. Vor über 150 Jahren gegründet, zählt Gruner heute über 30 Standorte in der Schweiz und weltweit. Kompetenz, Fachwissen und langjährige Erfahrung mit komplexen Bauvorhaben im In- und Ausland zeichnen die Gruner aus.  

Stellenbeschreibung

  • Projektmanagement Realisierung (Phase 51-53)
  • Gewerksübergreifende Qualitätssicherung Realisierung
  • Führung der Unternehmer in der Phase Realisierung
  • Kosten- und Terminmanagement
  • Führung / Teilnahme an den Ausführungsbesprechungen mit dem Bauherr, Architekten und Unternehmer
  • Organisation und Führung der Funktionstest und Inbetriebnahmen 
  • Organisation, Führung und Dokumentation der Abnahmen

Qualifikationen

  • Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung als Installateur oder Planer (Weiterbildung zum Meister, HF/TS oder ähnliches von Vorteil)
  • Mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Bauleitung von mittleren und grösseren Projekten 
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Gebäudetechnik sowie Gute Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement (Interne Weiterbildung möglich)
  • Kundenorientiert, hohe Sozialkompetenz, Teamplayer
  • Ziel- und ergebnisorientierte Persönlichkeit

Zusätzliche Informationen

Gruner bietet den Mitarbeitenden das Beste aus zwei Welten: Dynamik und Kollegialität in einem überschaubaren Arbeitsumfeld, Sicherheit und Professionalität eines grossen Unternehmens. Als attraktiver Arbeitgeber bieten wir Ihnen moderne Arbeitsbedingungen, hervorragende Sozialleistungen, anspruchsvolle Projekte und interessante berufliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten.

Fachliche Fragen zur Stelle beantwortet Herr Frank Ullmann Ihnen gerne, Tel. +41 61 367 96 33 oder [email protected]

job.title: Service Technician USA in Rockford, Illinois
job.plaincontent:
Servicetechniker USA für die Drahtindustrie in Rockford, Illinois Die Schlatter Gruppe ist ein führender Anlagenbauer für Widerstands- schweisssysteme für branchenspezifische Lösungen sowie Web- und Ausrüstmaschinen für Papiermaschinen-bespannungen, Draht- und Gittergewebe. Mit ihrem langjährigen Know-how in der Anlagentechnik, mit Innovationskraft und zuverlässigem Kundenservice garantieren wir unseren Kunden leistungsstarke und werthaltige Produktionsanlagen. Ihre Aufgaben Ihre Qualifikation Unsere Leistungen
Inbetriebsetzung von Systemen, Anlagen Grundausbildung als Elektro- oder Einführung an unserem Hauptsitz in und Komponenten bei unserer Kundschaft Maschinenmechaniker Schlieren/Schweiz
in primär Nordamerika aber auch weltweit Gute Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung in Anspruchsvolle und entwicklungs- Endabnahme von Anlagen, wie auch An- Elektro- und Antriebstechnik sowie fähige Stelle in einem professionellen, und Umbauten, Revisionen und Repara- Pneumatik, Hydraulik, SPS-Steuerungen jungen und hochmotivierten Team
turen und PC-Kenntnisse Umfassende Einarbeitung und laufende Schulung des Kundenpersonals bezüglich Gute Deutschkenntnisse und sehr gute Weiterbildung
Bedienung, Wartung, Störungsbehebung Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Unterstützung bei Transfer und und Sicherheitseinrichtungen Spanisch von Vorteil Wohnsitznahme in Rockford, IL Erstellen von Technik-Feedbacks aus Hohe Reisebereitschaft, Einsätze in USA dem Service von 2 Tagen bis 5 Wochen, gelegentlich
auch länger Innendienstaufgaben in Rockford, Illinois (Helpdesk, Revisionen, Kundendemos) Selbständige, flexible und belastbare Persönlichkeit mit Organisations- und Kommunikationstalent
Auswandern in die USA? Realisieren Sie Ihren Lebenstraum mit uns!
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Senden Sie uns bitte Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen, vorzugsweise per E-Mail. Möchten Sie mehr erfahren? Martina Demarmels, Leiterin Human Resources, erteilt gerne weitere Auskünfte. Wir freuen uns, Sie bald persönlich kennenzulernen.
